image.altText: A woman with dark blonde hair pulled back smiles lightly.

props.synopsis: The ACT health minister apologises for mistakes that lead to the death of Jessica Bovill, who was given a dose of sodium bicarbonate "far in excess" of what was recommended, resulting in her death at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Jessica died due to a hospital error. Her family was told it was suicide

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old Canberra man pleads not guilty in the ACT Magistrates Court to allegedly performing a Nazi salute in front of the Gold Coast Hebrew Congregation in October last year.

title.children: Canberra man charged with performing Nazi salute outside synagogue

image.altText: A pharmacist in a chemist.

props.synopsis: Every morning when Chris Lawler opens the doors of his Canberran pharmacy, he knows some of the customers won’t be coming to purchase, but to steal. A new online portal offers hope things might get better.

title.children: Shoplifters raid this pharmacy ‘daily’, but police are too busy to act

image.altText: A brunette woman hugs her elderly mother.

props.synopsis: The ACT government will support Burrangiri Aged Care Respite Centre to stay open for another two years.

title.children: 'I was disgusted': Residents applaud delay of respite service closure

image.altText: Head on shot of the L2 Circular Quay light rail tram

props.synopsis: With light rails under construction around the nation, the case brought by Sydney businesses against Transport for NSW in the High Court today could set a precedent for compensation claims.

title.children: Should government pay for business woes over Sydney's light rail?

image.altText: A man in hand-cuffs is escorted by two police officers along a road.

props.synopsis: A case where a group of men allegedly impersonated police to break into a Mawson home appears before the ACT Magistrates Court, with police saying they believe the victim was mistakenly targeted.

title.children: Pair allegedly impersonated police in Canberra home invasion

image.altText: A woman wearing a rainbow striped sweater with dark hair in a bun sits on a couch doing a puzzle.

props.synopsis: A global shortage of ADHD medications is forcing doctors to get creative and pushing pharmacists into a "Hunger Games" style battle to secure supply.

title.children: Hunger Games battle for ADHD medication reaches peak in Canberra

image.altText: An Air Canada plane parked on the tarmac, taken on an unspecified date.

props.synopsis: The 2019 Vancouver to Sydney flight experienced significant turbulence at 36,000 feet. It landed in Honlulu, Hawaii, with 37 injuries recorded, nine of which were major.

title.children: Passengers who claimed injuries from turbulence lose High Court appeal

image.altText: The facade of the Goulburn Local Court, with its sign in front.

props.synopsis: A man charged over the fatal accidental shooting of a nine-year-old boy near Goulburn faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man faces court over accidental fatal shooting of 9yo near Goulburn

image.altText: A black and white image of a nursey full of babies, with a blue cross above one baby's head and the word "Elizabeth".

props.synopsis: Elizabeth Wray and Rohan Samara are two of the thousands of children evacuated from Vietnam at the fall of Saigon 50 years ago as part of Operation Babylift. They're embarking on a quest to find their biological families.

title.children: Liz and Rohan arrived in Australia in boxes. They're looking for their families

image.altText: Two adults and three children running along a beach, laughing.

props.synopsis: Kate and Kriss Hardman are determined to make joyful memories with their three young children as they travel around Australia under the cloud of breast and prostate cancers.

title.children: Mum of three with terminal cancer says 'don't wait to live your life'

image.altText: Two young PNG boys stand in front of a pile of rocks, one looking directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: The World Health Ogranization says wild poliovirus type 2 was eradicated in 1999, but the deadly disease has been detected just over 500 kilometres from Australia's northern border.

title.children: A disease Australia wiped out in 2000 has resurfaced in our closest neighbour

image.altText: Go-Jo on stage with arms out, red scarf and blue jumpsuit with billowing smoke around him

props.synopsis: Marty Zambotto, 29, known as Go-Jo, gyrates across the Eurovision Song Contest stage in the second semifinal, but fails to make the cut.

title.children: Australia misses Eurovision final for second year in a row

image.altText: trees on roof of house with holes

props.synopsis: When a ferocious storm tore through this small Gippsland town, residents did not wait for government help to rebuild — they helped themselves. Here's how they did it.

title.children: What do you do when your town is destroyed? Ask locals in Mirboo North

image.altText: Chris brown on stage wearing a red jumper

props.synopsis: R&B singer Chris Brown has been charged with grievous bodily harm with intent over an incident at a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: Singer Chris Brown charged over alleged nightclub assault

image.altText: A slim elderly man in light blue shirt and glasses walks towards the camera outside a building on a sunny day

props.synopsis: A woman who survived sexual abuse at the hands of a convicted paedophile former priest fears he will hurt her again if the Timor-Leste government succeeds in having him pardoned.

title.children: Timor-Leste proposes pardon for 'evil' paedophile former priest

image.altText: Singer Cassie and Sean Combs pose on the red carpet, Diddy is wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The prosecution's star witness, Casandra "Cassie" Ventura, is cross-examined about drugs, sex and infidelity at Sean "Diddy" Combs's sex trafficking and racketeering trial.

title.children: 'Always ready to freak off': Cassie quizzed over texts at Diddy trial

image.altText: Bundee Aki and James Lowe hug

props.synopsis: With two Aussies, three New Zealanders and a couple of former junior Springboks, some members of the British press have criticised the make up of the British and Irish Lions squad. The numbers suggest that this is just part of the trend.

title.children: How the British and Irish Lions squad is raising questions over nationality

image.altText: A poor quality photo of a man with a knife on an escalator, taken from above.

props.synopsis: The Bondi Junction stabbing inquest has revealed numerous "concerning" red flags in Joel Cauchi's behaviour.

title.children: Bondi killer asked girls' school to let him watch swim carnival and netball

image.altText: Two people walk past a steel sign reflecting in the sunlight that reads "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Australia's RBA is meeting on Tuesday, but relatively strong wages and jobs data could see the board cut by less than some predicted. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Rate cuts forecast for both Australia and US

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Japan's economy shrinks by surprising amount
Rate cuts to load households up with more debt, analyst warns

image.altText: Cam Davis hits his tee shot with an iron, watching the ball in flight

props.synopsis: Australian Cam Davis has a share of second place after the first round of the US PGA Championship, with compatriot Adam Scott three strokes behind.

title.children: Davis tied second after first round of US PGA Championship

image.altText: Nishan Velupillay  celebrates a Socceroos goal against Indonesia.

props.synopsis: Nishan Velupillay is firing the Socceroos towards the 2026 FIFA World Cup with his qualification goals, but his biggest impact on football in Australia will be felt in generations to come.

title.children: Socceroos 'magician' Velupillay flipping script for future generations

image.altText: Sussan Ley

props.synopsis: From party leadership votes to missing ballot papers and plunging spacecrafts to luxury aeroplanes, this week was a big one. Test yourself on how much you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new Liberal leader, a luxury aeroplane and Eurovision

image.altText: A white man in a suit stands in front of a screen with a series of days and weather, pointing to it

props.synopsis: Increasingly complex technology means forecasts are significantly better than they were decades ago — here's why.

title.children: How many days ahead can the weather be accurately predicted?

image.altText: An old photo of two footballers standing with their coach on a football field.

props.synopsis: Premiership coach Paul Roos reveals he dashed home to Melbourne from the United States to farewell his coaching mentor Robert Walls.

title.children: 'Grateful' Roos reveals how he dashed home to farewell AFL champ Walls

image.altText: A photo of a young couple smiling at the camera while sitting in the backseat of a car

props.synopsis: Former Olympian cyclist Melissa Hoskins died after being struck by a car driven by her husband outside their Adelaide home. This is how the case against Rohan Dennis unfolded.

title.children: How an argument ended with the 'unfair and tragic' death of a champion cyclist

image.altText: Ali Brigginshaw, Olivia Kernick and Yasmin Clydsdale

props.synopsis: The Dally M medallist shines, a controversial try, damaging defence, and driving rain in a watershed win for the Blues. Here are five quick hits from Women's State of Origin Game II.

title.children: Five quick hits: Blues overcome bunker and bludger of a pitch in Origin II

image.altText: A woman in a red dress with red painted nails toasting a man with champagne.

props.synopsis: In the 'sugar dating' world, attractive young women date rich older men to facilitate the kind of romance you pay for. But things can go wrong when sex mixes with money, wealth and power.

title.children: What life is like as a sugar baby who dates older men

image.altText: A man in a black button-up shirt looks animated while speaking with a microphone in hand

props.synopsis: The US president has cast doubt over the meeting between officials from Kyiv and Moscow producing any significant progress on ending the three-year conflict.

title.children: Russia-Ukraine peace talks in jeopardy, Zelenskyy says Russia 'not serious'

image.altText: Greens leader Larissa Waters

props.synopsis: In one of her first interviews as leader, Larissa Waters tells the ABC of her desire for the next parliament to be more constructive, and have "heart", but says she won't shy away from the tough stance the Greens took on past issues like housing.

title.children: Greens leader Larissa Waters wants 'heart' in new term of parliament

image.altText: Black and white photo of three members of Sigur Rós standing in the snow

props.synopsis: Sigur Rós return to Australia this week, re-imagining their epic, ethereal music with the help of local symphony orchestras.

title.children: After 25 years, Sigur Rós are used to people fainting at their concerts

image.altText: a bowl of oysters

props.synopsis: A secluded estuary on Western Australia's south coast is becoming a major hub for Australia's aquaculture industry.

title.children: Oyster growers fight to preserve their 'Goldilocks' harbour in WA

image.altText: A person tries to pick up a fence that is leaning over in a big puddle.

props.synopsis: Floodwater has receded and paddocks are drying across western Queensland, revealing thousands of kilometres of damage that will take years to rebuild.

title.children: 'Great Australian fence hunt' underway as western Queensland rebuilds
